qas.question: The grid covers the length of the island from what starting point?
Which street do numbered streets begin just north of?
In what village is East Houston Street located?
Which Village already had streets when the grid plan was laid out?
Who laid out the Grid Plan?

context: Although the numbered streets begin just north of <a1_0>East Houston Street<a1_0/> in the <a2_0>East Village<a2_0/>, they generally do not extend west into <a3_0>Greenwich Village<a3_0/>, which already had streets when the grid plan was laid out by the <a4_0>Commissioners' Plan of 1811<a4_0/>. Streets that do continue farther west change direction before reaching the Hudson River. The grid covers the length of the island from <a0_0>14th Street north<a0_0/>.
